description: egmont india 12
egmont india 13

It’s the grand finale and shocking end that will leave you wanting more! No, not of the series, but just this arc! With The Crisis on Infinite Darkwings reaching its zenith, an old evil (and no, we’re not talking Uncle Scrooge here people!) reemerges as the true source of St. Canard's terrible water troubles! Cringe as both hero and villain find themselves treading turbulent terror! Gasp as the Darkwing Ducks rally to turn the tide toward triumph! Run to pick up the exciting conclusion of Crisis on Infinite Darkwings!
name: Crisis on Infinite Darkwings

description:
Season Eight has at last brought Buffy the long way home, and betrayal comes in the shape of the closest, most unexpected individual of all. Reeling from their losses, the Scoobies will never be the same again.

Series creator Joss Whedon and series artist Georges Jeanty bring you the biggest Buffy finale ever!
name: Last Gleaming, Part Five

volume.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer Season Eight

description:
1. Survival... or Death!
 
2. The Thing in the 'Glades
 
3. Kamen's Kalaminity!
 
4. Buried Treasure!
name: Survival... or Death!

description:
This First Comics graphic novel reprints the Hard Times storyline from American Flagg #1-3. It introduces Reuben Flagg and several of the main characters

There are nine new pages of art and story adding a prologue to the story:

A shuttlecraft is enroute from Gagaringrad on Luna, headed for the Plex terminal outside Chicago, carrying the crew and only two passengers. To alleviate the boredom of the routine flight, the pilot and co-pilot take turns napping and fraternizing with the flight attendants.

Other changes from the original: the art has been completely re-colored; some of the dialogue has been altered to include more explicit language; the book includes an introduction by SF/fantasy author Michael Moorcock.
name: Hard Times

deck: The year is 2032. Corruption, prostitution, and cameras are everywhere; from the top of what's left of the American government to the bottom of the sleaziest pit imaginable. When former vid star Reuben Flagg is drafted into the Plexus Rangers, he's sent to Chicago, a cesspool of gang violence, dirty politics and urban warfare. It's enough to crush an ordinary man but Reuben is a survivor and with the help of his new friends, he just might be the man to put it all back together.
description:
Reuben is tasked to escort C.K. Blitz's illegal black market basketball team, The Skokie Skullcrushers to Brasilia South America. He becomes embroiled in a plot by clandestine members of the American Survivalist Labor Committee to either recruit him or kill him. Hijinks ensue.

First Comics Graphic Novel collecting American Flagg 4-6.
name: Southern Comfort

deck: The year is 2032. Corruption, prostitution, and cameras are everywhere; from the top of what's left of the American government to the bottom of the sleaziest pit imaginable. When former vid star Reuben Flagg is drafted into the Plexus Rangers, he's sent to Chicago, a cesspool of gang violence, dirty politics and urban warfare. It's enough to crush an ordinary man but Reuben is a survivor and with the help of his new friends, he just might be the man to put it all back together.
description:
Dormant Russian weather satellite Sprite is reactivated by a wayward meteor strike, plunging the entire upstate area of Illinois into one of the worst Blizzards on record. This gets complicated when the 4 Worlds Airways luxury liner Norman Bel Getteys crashes in the wilderness with Medea Blitz on board. Reuben lands smack in the middle of a Plex plot to sell off most of Midwestern United States when a murder investigation goes sideways.

First Comics Graphic Novel Collecting American Flagg! issues 7-9 and The American Flagg Dossier pages from the relevant issues by Meyerson and Chaykin.

The cover is an homage to American Flagg! issue #8. Painted by Howard Chaykin.
name: State of the Union

volume.name: American Flagg!: State of the Union
Elric: Sailor on the Seas of Fate
Elric: The Weird of the White Wolf
Hammer of God: Sword of Justice
Hammer of God: Sword of Justice
Hawkmoon: The Jewel in the Skull

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the second book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff cycle.
description: Chapter one of the comics adaptation of the second book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff series. Dorian Hawkmoon and his companion Oladahn arrive in the city of Soryandum. There, they get captured by the armies of Huillam D'Averc, only to be rescued shortly thereafter by the city's inhabitants that have used their magic and technology to slip dimensions so that they appear as wraiths.
name: The Mad God's Amulet: Book One

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the second book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff cycle.
description: Chapter two of the comics adaptation of the second book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff series. Hawkmoon and Oladahn set out by ship but are soon attacked by pirates of The Cult of the Mad God. Later they encounter The Warrior of Jet and Gold who apprises them of the kidnapping of Yisselda, Hawkmoon's fiance and of the Mad God's involvement with it.
name: The Mad God's Amulet: Book Two

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the second book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff cycle.
description: Chapter three of the comics adaptation of the second book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff series. Hawkmoon and his crew arrive at The Mad God's castle and after a prolonged fight with the castle defenders, Hawkmoon procures The Mad God's amulet.
name: The Mad God's Amulet: Book Three

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the second book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff cycle.
description: Chapter four of the comics adaptation of the second book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff series. Hawkmoon and crew reunite with The Warrior of Jet and Gold to defend their home.
name: The Mad God's Amulet: Book four

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the final book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff series.
description: Part one of First Comics' adaptation of the fourth book in Michael Moorcock's epic fantasy series. Hawkmoon attempts to deny his destiny by returning home to Kamarg. Destiny has other ideas, however, when his ship runs aground on an island inhabited by Orland Fank, the brother to the late Knight of Jet and Gold. Fank redirects Hawkmoon back to his quest for the Runestaff.
name: The Runestaff part one

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the final book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff series.
description: Part two of First Comics' adaptation of the fourth book in Michael Moorcock's epic fantasy series. As Hawkmoon battles Shenegar over control of the Runestaff, simultaneous plots are hatched for the conquest of the Dark Empire and Kamarg.
name: The Runestaff part two

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the final book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff series.
description: Part three of First Comics' adaptation of the fourth book in Michael Moorcock's epic fantasy series. Meliadus marches against the Dark Empire, Taragorm brings Kamarg back from its pocket dimension, and Orland brings gifts to help Hawkmoon in the coming battle.
name: The Runestaff part three

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the final book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff series.
description: Part four of First Comics' adaptation of the fourth book in Michael Moorcock's epic fantasy series. Meliadus wins the battle to rule the Dark Empire and installs Lady Flana as its new queen. Meanwhile, Hawkmoon marches on Londra, the imperial capital.
name: The Runestaff part four

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the third book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff cycle.
description: The first chapter in First Comics' adaptation of Michael Moorcock's third book in his Runestaff quartet. Hawkmoon and D'Averc go undercover to infiltrate the dark empire while Meliadus searches for the secrets to dimensional travel.
name: The Sword of the Dawn part one

volume.name: Hawkmoon: The Sword of the Dawn

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the third book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff cycle.
description: Chapter two in First Comics' adaptation of the third book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff series. Hawkmoon, D'Averc and Meliadus set out for the mountains of Yel. There the wizard Mygan leads them into an alternate dimension to search for the sword of the dawn.
name: The Sword of the Dawn Part Two

volume.name: Hawkmoon: The Sword of the Dawn

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the third book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff cycle.
description: Chapter three of First Comics' adaptation of the third book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff quartet. Hawkmoon and D'Averc are captured at sea by pirates led by the evil Valjon.
name: The Sword of the Dawn part three

volume.name: Hawkmoon: The Sword of the Dawn

deck: First Comics' adaptation of the third book in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff cycle.
description: The final book in First Comics' adaptation of the third novel in Michael Moorcock's Runestaff quartet. Hawkmoon and D'Averc battle more pirates to save Bewchard and claim the Sword of the Dawn.
name: The Sward of the Dawn Part Four

volume.name: Hawkmoon: The Sword of the Dawn
